page.title: 15The Charter Fair
page.content: Traditionally a fair is held on May 10 in the Old Town.This year it was on a Friday when we were surveying there. Old Beaconsfield had changed overnight from a quiet,sedate town to a bright, busy fair. The fair takes up all the pavement and spills onto the road. The fair started coming in 1269. There is a rule that if a fair is missed even once it is never allowed to come back. It caters for all people. There are "win a goldfish" stalls for children, fast rides for teenagers and darts and rifle shooting for adults.It is very noisy and fun with the lights flashing on and off, the music blaring out,a different song for each ride and, of course, the delicious smell of candy floss and hamburgers. There is only one real snag, the prices go up from 80p to 1.60 the later it gets.
